document_title: Pulmonary valve stenosis: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Pulmonary valve stenosis affects the body's ability to supply oxygen to the blood. Many children are born with this disease, but do not show any symptoms until adulthood. Common symptoms include:
Shortness of breath; Abnormal sounds such as heart murmurs (heard with a stethoscope); Chest pain; Faint; Heart beats fast; Pale skin; Fatigue of unknown cause
Chest pain is a common symptom when the pulmonary valve is narrowed
Pulmonary stenosis can cause sudden death in severe cases. That is why early diagnosis and timely treatment are so important for the patient's health. Because in many patients, signs may not appear until the condition becomes more serious.
